name: "American Idol" Season 2 Online Quiz | American Idol: Season 2 | 15 Questions

questions.text: How many contestants were chosen from LA to contend in the final countdown for "American Idol"?
questions.explanation:
32.

	They were four groups with eight contestants each.  The two highest vote getters went onto the final twelve.  There were over 70,000 people who initially auditioned for season 2.

questions.text: What state was Julia DeMato from?
questions.explanation:
Connecticut.

	She was a hairdresser from Connecticut.  She was the third contestant to be voted off.

questions.text: What clothing style did Ruben make famous?
questions.explanation:
205 jersey shirts.

	Ruben created his own sense of style and now everyone will always associate the 205 as his trademark.

questions.text: Which contestant sang the Bee Gees song "Grease"?
questions.explanation:
Clay Aiken.

	This was one of the only songs that Clay sang that Simon said was absolutely horrible.

questions.text: How many times was Josh Gracin sent to center stage for the bottom two contestants?
questions.explanation:
2.

	He was center stage with Kimberley Locke when he was voted off.

questions.text: Which contestants had birthdays during the run of "American Idol"?
questions.correct: Carmen Rasmusen, Ruben Studdard, Kimberly Caldwell, and Treynce
options: Carmen Rasmussen, Ruben Studdard,  Trenyce, and Clay Aiken
Kimberly Caldwell, Carmen Rasmusen, Josh Gracin, and Ricky Smith
Kimberly Caldwell, Trenyce,  Clay Aiken, and Corey Clark
questions.explanation:
Carmen Rasmusen, Ruben Studdard, Kimberly Caldwell, and Treynce.

	Kimberly Caldwell turned 21, Carmen turned 18.  What a way to spend your birthday. Ruben turned 25 on April 13th.

Carmen.

	Carmen was a high school senior who received home schooling while she was on the show.

questions.text: Rickey Smith was the first contested voted off by the audience.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Vanessa Olivarez was the first contestant booted.

questions.text: Which of the following was a guest judge on the show?
questions.explanation:
Olivia Newton-John.

	Of course Madonna and Michael Jackson were not on the show, but they should be considered for season 3.

questions.text: Who were the last five contestants on the show?
questions.correct: Clay, Ruben, Treynce, Josh, and Kimberley L.
options: Clay, Ruben, Treynce, Josh and Carmen
Clay, Ruben, Treynce, Josh and Julia
Clay, Ruben, Treynce, Josh and Corey
questions.explanation: Clay, Ruben, Treynce, Josh, and Kimberley L.

Kimberley Locke.

	Kimberley Locke chose this Natalie Cole song because she felt it really would show off her range.

questions.text: Who was known as "the velvet teddy bear"?
questions.explanation:
Ruben.

	He was termed this by Gladys Knight.

questions.text: Who were the final three contestants?
Approximately what was the vote difference between the two finalists Ruben and Clay?
questions.explanation:
130,000.

	Ryan Seacrest was told wrong at the beginning of the show that the difference was about 13,000, then he corrected with 1300.
